bioghist.p: James Bonar was the son of the Rev. John James Bonar, a Minister at Greenock, and he was born in 1839. Bonar died in 1915.

scopecontent.p: The material is composed of correspondence relating to the publication of the Free Church of Scotland's Home and school hymnal (1892).

arrangement.p: The material is arranged per box: Adams-Astley; Ballantyne-Crippen; Crump-Hatch; Havergal-MacNaughton; March-Rundle-Charles; and, Sanders-Young.

relatedmaterial.p: The local Indexes at Special Collections Division, Edinburgh University Library, George Square, show a reference to Bonar related material (check the Indexes for more details): letters of Bonar to O. Goldschmidt about the preparation of a hymnal, 1896, at Dk.6.19/2.
